AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where Raymond McMillon's case was heard, with the judge entering ends-of-justice findings before denying his motion to dismiss and before trial, received canine records and made docket orders. Ruled on Raymond McMillon's motion to suppress. Also the court that affirmed Raymond McMillon's conspiracy conviction. Clearly articulated its reasoning for denying Raymond McMillon's § 3B1.2 request at sentencing. Conducted a one-day jury trial. Considered threshold questions regarding standing to challenge searches. Made decisions on the speedy trial clock and granted continuances. Received submissions, held hearings, and made decisions on motions. Signed proposed orders and granted continuances based on ends-of-justice findings. Denied the motion to dismiss and began Raymond McMillon's trial. Received the first set of canine records for in camera inspection pursuant to its October 15 docket order. Ruled on Raymond McMillon's motion to suppress after a 30-day advisement period. Heard Raymond McMillon's conspiracy case and affirmed his conviction.
